tab_content.accordion_title: Can I talk to a doctor on Maple about my kidney infection?
tab_content.accordion_intro: Yes. In some cases, a doctor on Maple can help you diagnose a kidney infection or manage a previously diagnosed kidney infection. They can write necessary prescriptions and recommend an appropriate course of treatment. If the doctor suspects you have a more serious problem, they may suggest that you go to a clinic or hospital for a thorough physical examination and treatment.

tab_content.accordion_title: Can I get a prescription on Maple?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Yes, our physicians can prescribe medications online during your consultation. Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or to have it delivered right to your door at no additional cost.

You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

A kidney infection is a severe urinary tract infection. It occurs when bacteria travels up the ureters and into your kidney. It can quickly become a medical emergency, so early treatment is essential.

tab_content.accordion_title: What are the symptoms of a kidney infection?
tab_content.accordion_intro:
Signs and symptoms of a kidney infection can include:

  • Fever and chills
  • Back, side, or groin pain
  • Abdominal pain
  • Frequent urination
  • A strong, persistent urge to urinate
  • Burning or pain while urinating
  • Pus or blood in urine
  • Urine that smells bad or is cloudy
  • Nausea and vomiting

Kidney infections are primarily treated with antibiotics. However, if the infection gets severe, you may be hospitalized for a course of IV antibiotics. Chronic kidney infections may  indicate a structural problem in your urinary tract, and you may be referred to a specialist for surgery.

With Maple, you can start talking to a doctor about your symptoms in a matter of minutes. We’re a healthcare app for fast, convenient 24/7 access to Canadian doctors.

You simply log in, tap a button to request a consultation, and we’ll immediately connect you to a doctor via live chat or video. You can visit our How it Works page to learn more.

Our doctors can assess symptoms, and provide treatment, including prescriptions as necessary.
